c74object.name: bach.change
c74object.digest: Filter out repetitions of an llll
c74object.description: The purpose of bach.change is the to act like a change object for lllls, outputting the incoming llll only if it differs from the one previously entered.

inlet.digest: The llll to be possibly filtered
Set incoming llll without triggering output

outlet.digest: The incoming llll if it changed
bang if the incoming llll hasn't changed

objarg.name: initial_llll
objarg.description: Put an llll as argument to set the initially stored llll, so that the same incoming llll will not pass right after the abstraction instantiation.

method.name: llll
method.description:
An llll in the first inlet is let through only if it is different from the previously received one. bach.change is initialized with a "null" llll, so if you send a "null" llll as first llll, it will not be let through.
An llll in second inlet is stored without triggering any output (as for the set message).

method.name: set
method.digest: Store llll without triggering any output
method.description:
Syntax: set <llll: point> <llll: llll>
An llll after the set message is stored without triggering any output (as for lllls coming in the second inlet).

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

c74object.discussion:
bach.change is initialized with a "null" llll, so if you send a "null" llll as first llll, it will not be let through.
A matchtype argument will tell if type has to be taken into account for equality testing.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: The llll to be possibly filtered.

entry.name: Inlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: Set incoming llll without triggering output.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: The incoming llll if it changed.

entry.name: Outlet 2 (bang)
entry.description: bang if the incoming llll hasn't changed.

entry.name: More details
entry.description:
bach.change is initialized with a "null" llll, so if you send a "null" llll as first llll, it will not be let through.
A matchtype argument will tell if type has to be taken into account for equality testing.
